decision_conditions: It is recommended that these trees as shown on the Havering TPO plan 16/63 as area A1 can have the works completed as in the schedule of works.
0C5A Group of 4x Prunus: Reduce crowns by 2m on all compass points to mitigate encroachment issues and maintain tree canopy size.
0C56 & 0C57 Poplar x2: Reduce crowns by 3-4m on all compass points to previous reduction points to control and manage tree size and height. Small holes around base.
0C55 Prunus: Reduce crown from 6m to 5m in height and North canopy aspect from 4m to 2.5m to re balance shape and mitigate encroachment to car park.
0C52 Poplar: Fell Southern stem rubbing with steel fence and pollard remaining stems to 10m from ground level for future maintenance due to lean over road towards buildings.
0C4X 2x Ash: Reduce and reshape crowns by 3m on all compass points to mitigate encroachment to adjacent property.
0C4U Ash: Self sown close to wall and adjacent driveway. Fell to ground level to avoid future issue and mitigate encroachme
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out to the standards detailed in British Standard Document BS 3998:2010.
To ensure that the work is carried out in accordance with good arboricultural practice.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out within 2 years from the date of this consent.
To prevent the accumulation of consents.

0C56 & 0C57 Poplar x2: The small holes around base, are evidence of the Hornet Moth, these trees should be put on a monitoring schedule and whilst these are considered a secondary agent of decline,  there is potential that here may be decay with in the stem and would be beneficial to explore further with decay detecting equipment.
description:
Request consent for the following work as part of an on going tree maintenance schedule.
0C5A Group of 4x Prunus: Reduce crowns by 2m on all compass points to mitigate encroachment issues and maintain tree canopy size.
0C56 & 0C57 Poplar x2: Reduce crowns by 3-4m on all compass points to previous reduction points to control and manage tree size and height. Small holes around base.
0C55 Prunus: Reduce crown from 6m to 5m in height and North canopy aspect from 4m to 2.5m to re balance shape and mitigate encroachment to car park.
0C52 Poplar: Fell Southern stem rubbing with steel fence and pollard remaining stems to 10m from ground level for future maintenance due to lean over road towards buildings.
0C4X 2x Ash: Reduce and reshape crowns by 3m on all compass points to mitigate encroachment to adjacent property.
0C4U Ash: Self sown close to wall and adjacent driveway. Fell to ground level to avoid future issue and mitigate encroachment.
0C4W Acer: Pollard to 4m from ground level retaining lower canopy growth points due to decay in stems and crown. Footpath beneath.
0C4S Ash: Poor crown form due to historic leader removal. Reduce North canopy aspect from 4m to 2.5m to re balance shape and encourage better crown formation.
0C4P 3x Poplars: Fell to ground level due to one sided leaning canopies over road towards buildings and butt sweep.
